name: japonica
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a bush or small tree grown for its red, pink, or white flowers and its small hard, yellow fruit: Japonica has pretty, round, scented, orange fruit to follow the scarlet flowers. The Japanese quince, Chaenomeles or japonica, is an entirely different plant from the quince tree. See also
quince
mainly US an evergreen bush (= one that never loses its leaves) with dark, shiny leaves and large white, pink, or red flowers that appear in late winter and look similar to roses: Everywhere japonicas are covered in blossom. Take cuttings of japonica, using side shoots. Synonym
camellia
More examplesFewer examplesIn April the beds were blooming with japonica, daffodils, and tulips.
